text: The cytokines <extra_id_0> interleukin (IL)-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IL-13 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> play a critical role in inducing Cepsilon germline transcripts and IgE isotype switching in human B cells .

The IL-4 receptor ( IL-4R ) in B cells is composed of two chains , the <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - binding <extra_id_0> IL-4Ralpha chain <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , which is shared with the IL-13R , and the <extra_id_0> IL-2Rgamma (gammac) chain <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , which is shared with <extra_id_0> IL-7R <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> IL-9R <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and IL-15R .

Induction of Cepsilon germline transcripts by <extra_id_0> IL-4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in B cells that lack the <extra_id_0> gammac chain <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> may involve signaling via the IL-13R .

We show that ligand - induced homodimerization of chimeric surface receptors consisting of the extracellular and transmembrane domains of the <extra_id_0> erythropoietin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> receptor and of the intracellular domain of <extra_id_0> IL-4Ralpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induces <extra_id_0> Janus kinase 1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> Jak1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) activation , <extra_id_0> STAT6 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activation , and Cepsilon germline transcripts in human B cell line BJAB .
